result.execSummary:
The defendant Remi Stepfon Ray Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Remi Stepfon Ray Williams is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Remi Stepfon Ray Williams was found guilty of Adjudged Delinquent Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Same conditions as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

miscConds.notes: Pay the costs, surcharges and disbursements as ordered.  Should defendant get revoked and sent to prison, the Court ordered all sums to be paid from prison funds.  To be taken by DOC and not to exceed 25%.  Balance to then be paid on Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.
Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational traiing.

Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor; futher advised defendastn of voting ineligibility.
No contact with B.A.M. 3/8/1997, or coactor Corvelle Williams.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Urine screens.
